name: Italian Stuffed Chicken with Boursin Cheese
ingredients: 4 small roasted red bell peppers (about 1 1/2 ounces each) *
Olive oil for drizzling (1/2 tablespoon per breast)

instructions.en: Prepare Boursin Cheese: Process cream cheese and garlic in a food processor until blended. Add remaining ingredients and process until well combined. Chill for at least 2 hours.
Butterfly the chicken breasts by making a shallow horizontal cut along the thickest long edge, stopping within 1/4 to 1/2 inch of the opposite edge.
Cut roasted red peppers open flat and pat dry.
Place chicken breasts on a large foil-lined baking sheet. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Lay one roasted red pepper on the bottom section of each opened chicken breast.
Spoon 1/4 of the Boursin cheese on top of each red pepper.
Fold the top flap of each breast over the filling, gently pressing to distribute the cheese.
Place 3 slices of tomato on top of each breast, overlapping them.
Drizzle tomatoes with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Optionally, sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 20 minutes or until the chicken is done.

notes: * You'll need to buy a 12 ounce jar of roasted red peppers but you probably won't need them all. ** Use about 2 1/2 ounces of tomato per chicken breast. This recipe makes 4 servings.
